Properties.Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptBody:
#Load Web Admin DLL
[System.Reflection.Assembly]::LoadFrom( "C:\windows\system32\inetsrv\Microsoft.Web.Administration.dll" ) | Out-Null
Add-PSSnapin WebAdministration -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Import-Module WebAdministration -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

$appPoolName = $OctopusParameters['AppPoolName']
$appPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64 = [boolean]::Parse($OctopusParameters['AppPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64'])

Write-Output "AppPoolName: $appPoolName"
Write-Output "AppPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64: $appPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64"

$prevValue = (Get-ItemProperty IIS:\apppools\$appPoolName -Name "enable32BitAppOnWin64").Value

if ($prevValue -ne $appPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64) {
    Set-ItemProperty IIS:\apppools\$appPoolName -name "enable32BitAppOnWin64" -Value $appPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64
    $newValue = (Get-ItemProperty IIS:\apppools\$appPoolName -Name "enable32BitAppOnWin64").Value
    Write-Output "IIS:\apppools\$appPoolName Changed 'enable32BitAppOnWin64' from $prevValue to $newValue."
} else {
    Write-Output "IIS:\apppools\$appPoolName 'enable32BitAppOnWin64' is already $appPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64 - Nothing changed."
}

Parameters.Name: AppPoolName
Parameters.Label: Application pool name
Parameters.HelpText: The name of the application pool that the application will run under.

Parameters.Name: AppPoolEnable32BitAppOnWin64
Parameters.Label: Enable 32-Bit Applications
Parameters.HelpText: Allows the application pool to run 32-bit applications when running on 64-bit windows.
